pages.title: Mana
pages.text: At the bottom left of your screen is your mana bar. Mana is a regenerating resource required to cast spells, and is primarily influenced by the Spell Effects within a given spell. However, some Spell Shapes have a additive multiplier that gets applied to the mana cost of any spell they're in.$(br2)Mana, by default, regenerates at a rate of 1 per second. This can be increased up to 2.5 per second by wearing Wizard Robes.

pages.title: Burnout
pages.text: When you don't have enough mana for a spell, and cast it anyways, you'll get a nasty effect known as Burnout. Burnout has a few drawbacks to be weary of:$(br)  - Your attacks become more sluggish$(br)  - Your health stops regenerating on its own$(br)  - You experience intense hunger$(br)  - Your maximum mana is reduced$(br2)The good news is Burnout goes away on its own, albeit slowly.

pages.title: Mana Lock
pages.text: Mana Lock is much like Burnout: it reduces your maximum mana. However, unlike Burnout, it doesn't drain over time nor does it have the other side effects of Burnout.$(br2)When the effect expires, it will simply go away all at once, allowing your mana to regenerate once again!
